cards.text: When you score Accelerated Beta Test, you may look at the top 3 cards of R&D. If any of those cards are ice, you may install and rez them, ignoring all costs. Trash the rest of the cards you looked at.
cards.title: Accelerated Beta Test

cards.flavor: "I solve problems."
cards.text: X[credit], [trash]: Choose a piece of rezzed ice protecting this server. That ice has +X strength until the end of the turn.
cards.title: Corporate Troubleshooter

cards.text: Place 1 agenda counter on AstroScript Pilot Program when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced. Limit 1 per deck. Errata from FAQ 3.1
cards.title: AstroScript Pilot Program

cards.text:
When you score Breaking News, give the Runner 2 tags.
When the turn on which you scored Breaking News ends, the Runner loses 2 tags.
cards.title: Breaking News

cards.flavor:
"I hear the coast is nice this time of year."
"If you're in the right business, it's nice all the year."
cards.text: The advancement requirement of agendas installed in this server is lowered by 1. Limit 1 region per server.
cards.title: SanSan City Grid

cards.flavor: "If some two-cred newsy picks it up, even better. The scum could be in the alleys of Guayaquil of the slums of BosWash. Not to mention off-planet."
cards.text: When you score Posted Bounty, you may forfeit it to give the Runner 1 tag and take 1 bad publicity.
cards.title: Posted Bounty

cards.flavor: "I'd like to remind the ladies and gentlemen of the press that several of the buildings damaged in the blast were owned by Weyland Consortium subsidiaries…"
cards.text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Do 4 meat damage.
cards.title: Scorched Earth

cards.flavor: Sometimes employee reviews took a little bit longer than anticipated.
cards.text: You have 1 additional [click] to spend each turn.
cards.title: Mandatory Upgrades

cards.flavor: "We're gonna need a bigger room."
cards.text: [click]: <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
cards.title: Restructured Datapool

cards.text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
<trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, trash 1 piece of hardware with an install cost equal to or less than the amount by which your trace strength exceeded the Runner's link strength.
cards.title: Power Grid Overload

cards.flavor: Dont Tread On Me
cards.text:
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, the Runner loses [click], if able.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, end the run.
cards.title: Viper

cards.text:
Place 14[credit] from the bank on Private Contracts when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Private Contracts, trash it.
[click]: Take 2[credit] from Private Contracts.
cards.title: Private Contracts

cards.flavor: Three heads. One big headache.
cards.text: When you rez Chimera, choose sentry, code gate, or barrier. Chimera gains that subtype until derezzed. When a turn ends, derez Chimera. [subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Chimera

cards.text:
Place 16[credit] from the bank on Eve Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Eve Campaign, trash it.
When your turn begins, take 2[credit] from Eve Campaign.
cards.title: Eve Campaign

cards.flavor: "That's against the rules. The Creators will be angry."
cards.text:
The Runner may spend [click] to break any subroutine on Eli 1.0.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Eli 1.0

cards.text:
Play only if the Runner stole an agenda during his or her last turn.
<trace>Trace 6</trace> If successful, give the Runner tags equal to the amount by which your trace strength exceeded his or her link strength.
cards.title: Midseason Replacements

cards.text:
When you score Director Haas' Pet Project, you may create a new remote server by installing up to 3 cards from HQ and/or Archives in that server and/or protecting that server (one at a time), ignoring all install costs.
Limit 1 Director Haas' Pet Project per deck.
cards.title: Director Haas' Pet Project

cards.text: Place 3 agenda counters on Efficiency Committee when you score it. [click], hosted agenda counter: Gain [click][click]. You cannot advance cards for the remainder of this turn.
cards.title: Efficiency Committee

cards.text:
Cerebral Overwriter can be advanced.
If you pay 3[credit] when the Runner accesses Cerebral Overwriter, do 1 brain damage for each advancement token on Cerebral Overwriter.
cards.title: Cerebral Overwriter

cards.flavor: The realm beyond is still forbidden.
cards.text:
The Runner can spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Heimdall 2.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage and end the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Heimdall 2.0

cards.text: The Runner can spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Viktor 2.0. Hosted power counter: Do 1 brain damage. [subroutine] Trace 2 If successful, place 1 power counter on Viktor 2.0. [subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Viktor 2.0

cards.flavor: Sell the dream-show them how very much they want to be rich, and they'll convince themselves that someday, they will be. How can they revolt against their future selves? -the New Gospel of Wealth
cards.text: [click], [click]: Gain 3[credit].
cards.title: Gila Hands Arcology

cards.flavor: The principle behind ice is not to keep everyone out, but to let only some people in. This ice denies entry on all but a select few ports that might change with the time of day or picosecond of connection. If you don't know what port to use, you're not getting in. Period.
cards.text: [subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Bastion

cards.flavor: "Cheap, off-the-shelf data protection. Cheap for them, that is. Not for us." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
cards.text:
[subroutine] The Runner must pay 2[credit], if able. If the Runner cannot pay 2[credit], end the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Datapike

cards.flavor: NEXT Design's ice provides the discerning business with a suite of ice that creates a daunting security presence for intruders.
cards.text: NEXT Bronze has +1 strength for each rezzed piece of NEXT ice. [subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: NEXT Bronze

cards.flavor: Pumping water into deep sea thermal vents produced huge amounts of energy. A profitable side effect.
cards.text: Place 2 agenda counters on Geothermal Fracking when you score it. [click], hosted agenda counter: Gain 7[credit] and take 1 bad publicity.
cards.title: Geothermal Fracking

cards.flavor: "The Grim of legend was one of many so-called 'black dog' myths common to Gaelic and English-speaking communities. What's fascinating is that it has propagated to the network, where it lives on as a program that, or so the story goes, hunts for the unwary." -The Professor
cards.text:
When you rez Grim, take 1 bad publicity.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
cards.title: Grim

cards.flavor: "They call it 'retirement'. I call it 'euthanasia'." -Ken "Express" Tenma
cards.text:
When you score Clone Retirement, you may remove 1 bad publicity.
When the Runner steals Clone Retirement, the Corp takes 1 bad publicity.
cards.title: Clone Retirement

cards.flavor: He signed for it, hand shaking in anticipation.
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Place up to 2 advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.
cards.title: Shipment from SanSan

cards.text:
Install only in a remote server.
The Runner cannot initiate a run on this server.
Whenever the Runner makes a successful run on HQ, trash Off the Grid.
cards.title: Off the Grid

cards.flavor: It was surprisingly easy to make creds…if you didn't care about how you made them.
cards.text: When you score Profiteering, take up to 3 bad publicity. Gain 5[credit] for each bad publicity taken.
cards.title: Profiteering

cards.flavor: There are many names for those in the Administration Department. But if you like your job, you just refer to them as "sir" and "ma'am".
cards.text: Gain 15[credit].
cards.title: Restructure

cards.flavor: "I'm getting a reading that is…off the charts. No, it crashed the charts. That counts as off, right?"
cards.text: Look at the top 3 cards of R&D. If any of those cards are operations, you may play them (paying their play cost), ignoring any additional costs. Trash the rest of the unplayed cards you looked at.
cards.title: Accelerated Diagnostics

cards.text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Trash X cards from the top of R&D. The Runner trashes 1 installed program or piece of hardware with an install cost of X or less. X is equal to or less than the highest install cost among all installed programs and pieces of hardware.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>

cards.flavor: "They're the only labor cheaper than clones."
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Install a card from Archives or HQ, ignoring the install cost.
cards.title: Interns

cards.text:
If Shock! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Shock!, do 1 net damage, even if it is not installed.
cards.title: Shock!

cards.flavor: "It's ice so dangerous it has safety protocols. Think about that." -g00ru
cards.text:
[subroutine] End the run unless the Corp pays 1[credit].
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
cards.title: Tsurugi

cards.flavor:
"Let me get this straight. Your target market is 15-19 year old g-modded immigrants with one parent, a discretionary income over 2k a month, B+ or higher grades, an outgoing personality, and have a friend who owns a g-monkey?"
"Yes. Is that a problem?"
"No, not at all. I just don't get why your list is so short."
cards.text: Gain 1[credit] for each card in the Runner's grip.
cards.title: Sweeps Week

cards.flavor:
[subroutine] End the game.
Just kidding.
cards.text:
If Curtain Wall is the outermost piece of ice protecting a server, it has +4 strength.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.

As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Name a card other than Reclamation Order. Reveal any number of copies of the named card from Archives and add them to HQ.
cards.title: Reclamation Order

cards.flavor: The first clone to serve as an NAPD detective.
cards.text: Whenever the Runner passes all of the ice protecting this server, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, end the run.
cards.title: Caprice Nisei

cards.text:
The advancement requirement of NAPD Contract is increased by 1 for each bad publicity the Corp has.
As an additional cost to steal NAPD Contract, the Runner must pay 4[credit].
cards.title: NAPD Contract

cards.flavor: It wants to have two subroutines when it grows up.
cards.text: [subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Quandary

cards.text: Place 3 agenda counters on House of Knives when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Do 1 net damage. Use this ability only during a run and only once per run.
cards.title: House of Knives

cards.flavor: "You won't feel it. Or anything else, for that matter."
cards.text: Lower the advancement requirement of each Medical Breakthrough by 1. This ability is active even while Medical Breakthrough is in the Runner's score area.
cards.title: Medical Breakthrough

cards.text: When the Runner accesses The Future Perfect, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, prevent The Future Perfect from being stolen. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses The Future Perfect while it is installed.
cards.title: The Future Perfect

cards.text:
The Runner's maximum hand size is reduced by 2.
If Chairman Hiro is trashed while being accessed, add him to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.
cards.title: Chairman Hiro

cards.flavor: The whitewashed walls dropped away and a beautiful zen garden appeared. It was all an illusion, but it was a comforting illusion.
cards.text:
Gain 1[credit] when your turn begins.
The Runner's maximum hand size is increased by 1.
cards.title: Mental Health Clinic

cards.text: If the Runner exposes or accesses Psychic Field while installed, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, do 1 net damage for each card in the Runner's grip.
cards.title: Psychic Field

cards.text: When the Runner accesses Shi.Kyū, you may pay X[credit]. The Runner must take either X net damage or add Shi.Kyū to his or her score area as an agenda worth -1 agenda point. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Shi.Kyū from R&D.
cards.title: Shi.Kyū

cards.flavor: "Together we have all but eradicated natural diseases from the face of this planet. The new spectre of synthetic disease-of bioterrorism-demands that we continue our efforts."
cards.text: Gain 8[credit]. The Runner gains 3[credit].
cards.title: Medical Research Fundraiser

cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Install an asset, agenda, or upgrade from HQ in a new remote server. Place 3 advancement tokens on that card. You cannot score or rez that card until your next turn begins.
cards.title: Mushin No Shin

cards.text: When the Runner encounters Komainu, it gains "[subroutine] Do 1 net damage." for each card in the Runner's grip for the remainder of this run.
cards.title: Komainu

cards.flavor: Yip Yip!
cards.text:
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
cards.title: Pup

cards.flavor: Certain areas of cyberspace are dominated by a single digital entity. Runners call them 'gods', and only a miracle can save those foolish enough to enter their domain.
cards.text: [subroutine] If not already running on Archives, the Runner is now running on Archives instead of passing Susanoo-no-Mikoto. The Runner cannot jack out until after he or she encounters a piece of ice.
cards.title: Susanoo-no-Mikoto

cards.flavor: YucaBean has seen astounding growth in even the most remote markets.
cards.text: Gain 1[credit] for each remote server with a card installed in it.
cards.title: Diversified Portfolio

cards.flavor: The longer the employees didn't look at the Doomsday Clock, the more it gnawed at the back of their minds. A quick look only reinforced what they already knew: there wasn't enough time.
cards.text: Search R&D for an agenda, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
cards.title: Fast Track

cards.text:
[click],[click],[click]: Place 1 agenda counter on Domestic Sleepers.
Domestic Sleepers is worth 1 agenda point while it has at least 1 agenda counter on it.
cards.title: Domestic Sleepers

cards.flavor: The networking capabilities of the NEXT suite of ice are unparalleled.
cards.text: NEXT Silver gains "[subroutine] End the run." for each rezzed piece of NEXT ice.
cards.title: NEXT Silver

cards.flavor: "Chi resonance mapping has created a whole new field of network security. It is unassailable perfection." -Akitaro Watanabe
cards.text:
The strength of Lotus Field cannot be lowered.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Lotus Field

cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, trash a rezzed piece of ice.
Reveal cards from the top of R&D until you reveal a piece of ice. Install and rez that ice in the same position as the ice that was trashed, ignoring all costs. Shuffle R&D.
cards.title: Mutate

cards.flavor: They said it couldn't be built. That it was a fantasy. That Jack Weyland was a fool, and he had bought the fools in Washington too. But year after year the buckyweave grew, and 'they' stopped talking.
cards.text:
3[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to advance, install, and rez cards.
cards.title: The Root

cards.flavor: On the first day She breathed data into the void, and it hung suspended like jewelled stars. On the second day She spoke order into the data, and it flowed from rivulets into streams and from streams into mighty rivers. On the third day She gave independence to the order, and it ebbed and flowed according to its own accord. -The Cant of Helios
cards.text:
Mother Goddess gains the subtypes of all other rezzed ice.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Mother Goddess

cards.flavor: He who bears the shield of honor.
cards.text: When the Runner encounters Galahad, you may reveal up to 2 grail ice from HQ. For the remainder of this run, Galahad gains the subroutines of the revealed ice in the order of your choice. [subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Galahad

cards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. As an additional cost to make the first run not made through a card ability on his or her turn, the Runner must spend [click].
cards.title: Enhanced Login Protocol

cards.flavor: Her eyes were the color of a vidscreen, tuned to a dead channel.
cards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The Runner's identity text box is blank.
cards.title: Cerebral Static

cards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. Gain 1[credit] whenever the Runner makes a successful run.
cards.title: Paywall Implementation

cards.text:
Ignore the install cost of the first piece of ice you install each turn.
Limit 1 per deck.
cards.title: Eden Fragment

cards.text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, you may trash Will-o'-the-Wisp. If you do, choose an icebreaker that was used to break at least 1 subroutine during this run. The Runner adds that icebreaker to the bottom of his or her stack.
cards.title: Will-o'-the-Wisp

cards.flavor: Eliza's Toybox is the preeminent purveyor of high-class debauchery on the moon, courtesy of its bioroid pleasure models and other exotica. Every fantasy has its price.
cards.text: [click],[click],[click]: Rez a card, ignoring all costs.
cards.title: Eliza's Toybox

cards.flavor: Mars would never have been colonized if not for the Gargarin facilities at Promontorium Agarum.
cards.text: Successful runs against this server are not considered to be successful or unsuccessful for the purposes of card abilities. Limit 1 region per server.
cards.title: Crisium Grid

cards.flavor: The irony is that those who'd want to destroy certain memories can't afford to do so, and those who can afford it-well, they're too busy sipping on dreamwine.
cards.text: When you score Chronos Project, the Runner removes all cards in his or her heap from the game.
cards.title: Chronos Project

cards.flavor: He who wields the sword of valor.
cards.text: When the Runner encounters Lancelot, you may reveal up to 2 grail ice from HQ. For the remainder of this run, Lancelot gains the subroutines of the revealed ice in the order of your choice. [subroutine] Trash 1 program.
cards.title: Lancelot

cards.flavor: <champion>Designed by 2012 World Champion Jeremy Zwirn</champion>
cards.text:
Architect cannot be trashed while installed.
[subroutine] The Corp looks at the top 5 cards of R&D and may install 1 of those cards, ignoring all install costs.
[subroutine] The Corp may install a card from Archives or HQ (paying all costs).
cards.title: Architect

cards.flavor: The way past is to go a different way.
cards.text: Ashigaru gains "[subroutine] End the run." for each card in HQ.
cards.title: Ashigaru

cards.text: Changeling can be advanced. While Changeling has an odd number of advancement tokens on it, it gains sentry and loses barrier. [subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Changeling

cards.text:
When your turn begins, you may add 1 card from Archives to the bottom of R&D.
Limit 1 per deck.

cards.flavor: "'What does it do?' Whatever I bloody want it to do." -Director Haas
cards.text: When you score Bifrost Array, you may trigger the "when scored" ability of another agenda that is not a copy of Bifrost Array in your score area.
cards.title: Bifrost Array

cards.flavor: "If thou only knowest what it is to conquer, and knowest not what it is to be defeated; woe unto thee…" -Tokugawa Ieyasu
cards.text: Whenever the Runner trashes a Corp card (including Hostile Infrastructure), do 1 net damage.
cards.title: Hostile Infrastructure

cards.flavor: "We've received seventeen crates from ChiLo. We'll hit stores the same day we sign the license agreement."
cards.text: When you score License Acquisition, install and rez an asset or upgrade from Archives or HQ, ignoring all costs.
cards.title: License Acquisition

cards.flavor: "Do it again, but this time I want to see you to enunciate less. Maybe let some spittle fly."
cards.text:
When your turn begins, you may rez a card, lowering the rez cost by 1[credit].
1[credit],[trash]: Search R&D for an asset, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
cards.title: Executive Boot Camp

cards.flavor: He who holds the staff of wisdom.
cards.text: When the Runner encounters Merlin, you may reveal up to 2 grail ice from HQ. For the remainder of this run, Merlin gains the subroutines of the revealed ice in the order of your choice. [subroutine] Do 2 net damage.
cards.title: Merlin

cards.text: [click]: Place 1 power counter on IT Department. Hosted power counter: Choose a rezzed piece of ice. That ice has +1 strength until the end of the turn for each power counter (including the one spent) on IT Department.
cards.title: IT Department

cards.flavor: A masterpiece of cloning and hardware technology, Jinteki created homo vacuo operae, commonly called "turtlebacks", to operate for long periods of time within a vacuum.
cards.text: Gain 1[credit] whenever you create a server.
cards.title: Turtlebacks

cards.text:
As an additional cost to steal an agenda, the Runner must pay 2[credit] for each advancement token on that agenda.
Limit 1 per deck.
cards.title: Utopia Fragment

cards.flavor:
There drew he forth the brand Excalibur,
And o'er him, drawing it, the winter moon,
Brightening the skirts of a long cloud, ran forth
And sparkled keen with frost against the hilt:
For all the haft twinkled with diamonds sparks,
Myriads of topaz-lights, and jacinth work
Of subtlest jewellery. -Lord Tennyson
cards.text: [subroutine] The Runner cannot make another run this turn.
cards.title: Excalibur

cards.flavor: It is essential to liberate a populace from tyranny before that tyranny takes root.
cards.text:
[click]: Gain 3[credit].
Limit 1 Government Takeover per deck.
cards.title: Government Takeover

cards.flavor: "Trust me. I know what I'm doing."
cards.text: Place 1 agenda counter on High-Risk Investment when you score it. [click], hosted agenda counter: Gain 1[credit] for each credit in the Runner's credit pool.
cards.title: High-Risk Investment

cards.flavor: As through the door of light he came.

Wormhole can be advanced and its rez cost is lowered by 3 for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] Resolve a subroutine on another piece of rezzed ice.
cards.title: Wormhole

cards.flavor: And seeking prey he then took aim.
cards.text:
Orion can be advanced and its rez cost is lowered by 3 for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Resolve a subroutine on another piece of rezzed ice.

Fire Wall can be advanced and gains +1 strength for each advancement token on it.

cards.flavor: "Don't worry. If this one fails, we can start a new one tomorrow."
cards.text: When your turn begins, you may trash Tech Startup. If you do, search R&D for an asset, reveal it, and install it. Shuffle R&D.

cards.flavor: Alan Turing laid the foundation for artificial intelligence by suggesting that you could teach a computer to be human.

Crick has +3 strength while protecting Archives.
[subroutine] Install a card from Archives (paying its install cost).

cards.flavor: Officially, there is no blacklist. That would be illegal. Unofficially, there is a list, and being on it can ruin a career.

cards.flavor: Johannes Gutenberg ignited the first Information Revolution by inventing the movable-type printing press.

Gutenberg has +3 strength while protecting R&D.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 7</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.

cards.flavor: Meru Mati pushed the limits of physics by engineering the first buckyweave structure, a thousand-foot long wall.
cards.text:
Meru Mati has +3 strength while protecting HQ.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Meru Mati

cards.flavor: After the Big One, real estate value changed sharply. Some found that they had become owners of beachfront property. Others were underwater.

cards.flavor: "A sysop is not just a cog in the corporate machine. They have dreams-and nightmares-just like the rest of us." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.

cards.flavor: "Let me tell you a secret. There's no such thing as impenetrable ice. It has to allow access, or else why is the server on the Network in the first place? But that doesn't mean they have to make it easy." -g00ru

[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.

cards.text:
Install Hollywood Renovation faceup.
Whenever you advance Hollywood Renovation, you may place 1 advancement token on another card that can be advanced (or 2 advancement tokens instead if there are 6 or more advancement tokens on Hollywood Renovation).
cards.title: Hollywood Renovation

cards.flavor:
EXT. KANSAS - DAY
DOROTHY (Miranda) gazes out at the horizon. A sudden gust of wind catches her hair. Above the windblasted prairie loom ominous STORM CLOUDS.
DOROTHY: If only I wasn't in Kansas anymore.
She begins to hum a haunting melody.
cards.title: Vanity Project

cards.flavor: The SanSan Outlaws have a close relationship with Haas-Bioroid's sports engineering division, SHIFT.
cards.text: Whenever you score an agenda, you may install a card from Archives or HQ, ignoring the install cost.
cards.title: Team Sponsorship

cards.flavor: The Genetics Pavilion was designed by renowned architect Meru Mati II. It was built without the aid of bioroids, instead relying on human and clone labor.
cards.text: The Runner cannot draw more than 2 cards during his or her turn.
cards.title: Genetics Pavilion

cards.text:
If the Runner accesses Product Placement from R&D, he or she must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Product Placement, the Corp gains 2[credit]. Ignore this effect if Product Placement is accessed from Archives.
cards.title: Product Placement

cards.flavor: "Hello, and welcome to the Universe of Tomorrow! You could live for five-hundred years and not see all of the attractions I can tell you about."
cards.text: Tour Guide gains "[subroutine] End the run." for each rezzed asset you have.
cards.title: Tour Guide

cards.text: When you score The Future is Now, search R&D for a card and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
cards.title: The Future is Now

cards.flavor: You had your shot, and you blew it.
cards.text:
[click]: Shuffle 15 Minutes into R&D. The Corp can trigger this ability while 15 Minutes is in the Runner's score area.
Limit 1 per deck.

cards.flavor: "Yes and No."
cards.text:
If Quantum Predictive Model is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
If the Runner is tagged when Quantum Predictive Model is accessed, add it to your score area.
cards.title: Quantum Predictive Model

If News Team is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses News Team, he or she must either take 2 tags or add News Team to his or her score area as an agenda worth -1 agenda point.
cards.title: News Team

cards.text:
If Archangel is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
If you pay 3[credit] when the Runner accesses Archangel, he or she immediately encounters it. Ignore this ability if Archangel is accessed from Archives.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 6</trace> If successful, add 1 installed Runner card to his or her grip.
cards.title: Archangel

cards.flavor: "Most reporting these days can be done by AI. We just need the talent for the name recognition."
cards.text: If a current is active, News Hound gains "[subroutine] End the run." after all its other subroutines. [subroutine] Trace 3 If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
cards.title: News Hound

cards.flavor: "In the Olden Times, a 'resistor" was a vital component of practically all electronic equipment. You know, back when dinosaurs roamed the Earth." -Chaos Theory
cards.text:
Resistor has +1 strength for each tag the Runner has.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, end the run.
cards.title: Resistor

cards.flavor: "If I didn't know better, I'd say they got the better end of that deal." -John Masanori
cards.text: [subroutine] The Corp gains 5[credit]. Trash Special Offer.

cards.flavor: "Stay out of the fast lanes! If speed's your only concern, you're already tagged and halfway to fragged." -g00ru
cards.text:
When the Runner encounters Turnpike, he or she loses 1[credit].
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 5</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.

cards.flavor: The only thing worse than bad news...

When you score Corporate Sales Team, place 10[credit] on it.
When each player's turn begins, take 1[credit] from Corporate Sales Team.
cards.title: Corporate Sales Team

cards.flavor: "Our research says the public views clones as more human than bioroids. Historically, this has been a liability. Let's make it a strength."
cards.text: When your turn begins, you may add 1 operation from Archives to HQ if there is no ice protecting this server.
cards.title: Clone Suffrage Movement

cards.flavor: "There's no conflict of interest here. These are complex issues with highly technical minutiae. It's only natural that the experts should lay down the guidelines."
cards.text: When your turn begins, do 1 net damage if there is no ice protecting this server.

cards.text: When your turn begins, you may draw 3 cards if there is no ice protecting this server. If you do, add 1 card from HQ to the bottom of R&D.
cards.title: Sensie Actors Union

cards.flavor: "Money is speech and I am listening intently." -Krishnan Sareen
cards.text: When your turn begins, gain 3[credit] if there is no ice protecting this server.

cards.flavor: Mumbad's public city corporation is tightly connected to all the other corporations.

cards.flavor: Efficiency means profiting from things everyone was doing anyway.

[subroutine] End the run.

cards.flavor: "Very good, sir."

has anyone heard from StatiX lately?
-post on Members Only newsgroup

cards.title: Timely Public Release

cards.flavor: <champion>Designed by 2017 World Champion Wilfy Horig</champion>
cards.text:
When the Runner encounters Slot Machine, put the top card of the stack on the bottom, then reveal the top 3 cards of the stack.
[subroutine] The Runner loses 3[credit].
[subroutine] If two of the revealed cards have the same type, the Corp gains 3[credit].
[subroutine] If three of the revealed cards have the same type, place 3 advancement tokens on an installed card.
cards.title: Slot Machine

cards.flavor: <champion>Designed by 2016 World Champion Chris Dyer</champion>
cards.text:
[trash]: End the run. Use this ability only during a run on this server.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 1[credit] for each piece of ice protecting this server.
[subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Border Control

cards.text: When you score Project Vitruvius, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3. Hosted agenda counter: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
cards.title: Project Vitruvius

cards.text: When you score Successful Field Test, install any number of cards from HQ, ignoring all costs.
cards.title: Successful Field Test

cards.text:
Put 12[credit] from the bank on Adonis Campaign when rezzed. When there are no credits left on Adonis Campaign, trash it.
Take 3[credit] from Adonis Campaign when your turn begins.
cards.title: Adonis Campaign

cards.text:
Aggressive Secretary can be advanced.
If you pay 2[credit] when the Runner accesses Aggressive Secretary, trash 1 program for each advancement token on Aggressive Secretary.
cards.title: Aggressive Secretary

cards.text:
Place 8[credit] on Marilyn Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Marilyn Campaign, trash it.
Take 2[credit] from Marilyn Campaign when your turn begins.
If Marilyn Campaign is trashed while installed, you may shuffle it into R&D instead of adding it to Archives.
cards.title: Marilyn Campaign

cards.flavor: "Do you think they…feel it?"
cards.text: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
cards.title: Archived Memories

cards.flavor: "Why of course, we have six different Haas-Bioroid models serving in a variety of positions at this branch office alone. We here at Haas-Bioroid aren't going to shy away from practicing what we preach, and we pass the savings from increased efficiency on to our valued customers."
cards.text: Gain [click][click].
cards.title: Biotic Labor

cards.flavor: Blue-one level clearance doesn't exist. And if it did exist, you wouldn't be cleared to know about it.
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Gain 5[credit] and draw 2 cards.
cards.title: Blue Level Clearance

cards.text:
If Fetal AI is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Fetal AI, do 2 net damage. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Fetal AI from Archives.
As an additional cost to steal Fetal AI, the Runner must pay 2[credit].
cards.title: Fetal AI

cards.text: Place 1 agenda counter on Nisei MK II when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: End the run.
cards.title: Nisei MK II

cards.text:
When you score Philotic Entanglement, do 1 net damage for each agenda in the Runner's score area.
Limit 1 Philotic Entanglement per deck.
cards.title: Philotic Entanglement

cards.text:
Project Junebug can be advanced.
If you pay 1[credit] when the Runner accesses Project Junebug, do 2 net damage for each advancement token on Project Junebug.
cards.title: Project Junebug

cards.flavor: "I will serve you…for a time."
cards.text:
Ronin can be advanced.
If there are at least 4 advancement tokens on Ronin, it gains "[click], [trash]: Do 3 net damage."
cards.title: Ronin

cards.text:
If Snare! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
If you pay 4[credit] when the Runner accesses Snare!, do 3 net damage and give the Runner 1 tag. Ignore this effect if the Runner accesses Snare! from Archives.
cards.title: Snare!

cards.flavor: As beautiful as it is dangerous. And it's plenty dangerous.
cards.text:
The first time the Runner spends 1 or more [click] during their turn, gain 2[credit]. If those [click] were spent to take an action, the first time during that action a run on this server begins, pay 2[credit].
<errata>Errata from CR 1.2</errata>
cards.title: Sundew

cards.flavor: The 'cyber-war' is a war of information, and in a war of information, advance warning can be as good as a killing blow. -Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime
cards.text:
[subroutine] Look at the top card of R&D. You may add that card to the bottom of R&D.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
cards.title: Yagura

cards.flavor: When Miranda Rhapsody showed up with a teacup giraffe, suddenly everybody wanted one.
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ to the Runner. Gain 2[credit] for each card revealed.
cards.title: Celebrity Gift

cards.flavor: The trick isn't hitting the person you were aiming at. It's hitting only the person you were aiming at.
cards.text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Do 1 net damage.
cards.title: Neural EMP

cards.flavor: Smoke and mirrors optional.
cards.text: Move up to 2 advancement tokens from a card to another installed card that can be advanced.
cards.title: Trick of Light

cards.flavor: It's like Lethal Action 3, only with more explosions.
cards.text:
If Explode-a-palooza is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Explode-a-palooza, you may gain 5[credit].
cards.title: Explode-a-palooza

cards.text:
When you score Project Beale, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 advancement tokens on it over 3.
Project Beale is worth 1 additional agenda point for each agenda counter on it.
cards.title: Project Beale

cards.flavor: "A new investment deal every morning! Grab the bull by the horns and take control of your future!"
cards.text: The first time you draw a card each turn, draw 1 additional card. Add 1 of the drawn cards to the bottom of R&D.
cards.title: Daily Business Show

cards.text:
Ghost Branch can be advanced.
When the Runner accesses Ghost Branch, you may give the Runner 1 tag for each advancement token on Ghost Branch.
cards.title: Ghost Branch

cards.text:
When your turn begins, take 1[credit] from Marked Accounts, if able.
[click]: Place 3[credit] from the bank on Marked Accounts.
cards.title: Marked Accounts

cards.flavor: Making a name for yourself has its perks. But it also makes you a target.
cards.text:
Reversed Accounts can be advanced.
[click], [trash]: The Runner loses 4[credit] for each advancement token on Reversed Accounts.
cards.title: Reversed Accounts

cards.text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
The Runner loses all credits in his or her credit pool.
cards.title: Closed Accounts

cards.flavor: Access to the largest consumer database in the galaxy has its advantages.
cards.text:
X is equal to or less than the number of tags the Runner has.
Place X advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.
cards.title: Psychographics

cards.flavor: "The SEA tipped us off to some suspicious data spikes up by the Castle." -Jerome Lock, on-duty tech
cards.text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
<trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
cards.title: SEA Source

cards.flavor: There are going to be some changes around here.
cards.text: When you score Hostile Takeover, gain 7[credit] and take 1 bad publicity.
cards.title: Hostile Takeover

cards.text:
Install Oaktown Renovation faceup.
Whenever you advance Oaktown Renovation, gain 2[credit] (or 3[credit] if there are 5 or more advancement tokens on Oaktown Renovation).
cards.title: Oaktown Renovation

cards.text: When you score Project Atlas, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3. Hosted agenda counter: Search R&D for 1 card, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
cards.title: Project Atlas

cards.flavor: "You want no questions asked, hire someone else. I have two: who and how much?"
cards.text: Contract Killer can be advanced. If there are at least 2 advancement tokens on Contract Killer, it gains: "[click], [trash]: Trash a connection or do 2 meat damage."
cards.title: Contract Killer

cards.text:
Place 3 power counters on Public Support when it is rezzed. When there are no power counters left on Public Support, add it to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
When your turn begins, remove 1 power counter from Public Support.
cards.title: Public Support

cards.flavor: The New Angeles Space Elevator, better known as the Beanstalk, is the single greatest triumph of human engineering and ingenuity in history. The Beanstalk makes Earth orbit accessible to everyone…for a small fee.
cards.text: Gain 3[credit].
cards.title: Beanstalk Royalties

cards.text: Rez a piece of ice, ignoring all costs, and install Oversight AI on that ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Trash host ice if all its subroutines are broken during a single encounter."
cards.title: Oversight AI

cards.flavor: "I'd say it's nothing personal, but corporations are people, too."
cards.text: <trace>Trace 5</trace> If successful, do meat damage to the Runner equal to the number of printed agenda points on agendas he or she stole during his or her last turn.
cards.title: Punitive Counterstrike

cards.flavor: It is like the one you just bought, only better.
cards.text: Gain 1[credit] when your turn begins.
cards.title: PAD Campaign

cards.flavor: Hedge Fund. Noun. An ingenious device by which the rich get richer even while every other poor SOB is losing his shirt. -The Anarch's Dictionary, Volume Who's Counting?
cards.text: Gain 9[credit].
cards.title: Hedge Fund

cards.text:
After you resolve this operation, end your action phase.
Gain 13[credit].
cards.title: IPO

cards.flavor:
"Early success should be rewarded, as it will encourage a culture of drive and competition."
-Corporate Leadership for Dummies
cards.text: When you score this agenda, look at the top 5 cards of R&D. You may install and rez 1 of those cards, ignoring all costs.
cards.title: Architect Deployment Test

cards.flavor: Unit is holding .78 asimovs of stress potential in all three directive logic traps. Psychiatric session mandated during next maintenance cycle.
cards.text:
[click]: Draw 2 cards. Use this ability only once per turn.
When the Runner trashes this asset, you may draw 2 cards.
cards.title: Calvin B4L3Y

cards.flavor: At the scale where nanobots cut glass, quantum mechanics dictate error. A silicon atom here, an oxygen there, an erbium out of place. Each bioroid is born unique.
cards.text:
[click]: Gain 2[credit]. Use this ability only once per turn.
When the Runner trashes this asset, you may gain 2[credit].
cards.title: Nanoetching Matrix

cards.flavor: Not all secrets lie in vaults.
cards.text:
Resolve two of the following in any order:
  • Draw 2 cards.
  • Gain 2[credit].
  • Install up to 1 non-agenda card.
  • Gain [click].
cards.title: Red Level Clearance

cards.flavor: The Net abhors a vacuum. Any unexplained gap must be made.
cards.text:
[click]: Place 1 power counter on this upgrade.
As an additional cost to run this server, the Runner must spend 1[click] and 1[credit] for each hosted power counter.
When your turn begins, remove all hosted power counters.
cards.title: Cold Site Server

cards.flavor:
"'It is my nature,' said the scorpion."
-Conceptual Frameworks in Bio-Ethics and Synthetic Morality, Moser University Press
cards.text: When a player scores or steals this agenda, do X net damage. X is equal to the number of copies of Sting! in the other player's score area plus 1.
cards.title: Sting!

cards.text:
After you resolve this operation, your action phase ends.
Play only if the Runner has 3 or more agenda points and they made a successful run during their last turn.
Name a card, then do 1 net damage. If you trash a copy of the named card, repeat this process.
cards.title: Complete Image

cards.text: The first time each run the Runner approaches this server, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit] or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, you may trash this upgrade to force the Runner to approach the outermost piece of ice protecting this server.
cards.title: Letheia Nisei

cards.flavor:
Scrub-loving devs nerfed cannon rushes cause whiny bronzers complained. Left me four wins down in finals.
Anyway I won.
cards.text: When you score this agenda, place 1 agenda counter on it. Hosted agenda counter: Place 1 advancement token on an installed card.
cards.title: Remastered Edition

cards.text:
Rez only during your action phase.
Whenever the Runner makes a successful run on this server, they gain 2[credit].
When your turn begins, gain 3[credit] if the Runner did not make any successful runs on this server during their last turn.
cards.title: Daily Quest

cards.flavor: "There's gonna be catering, right?"
cards.text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during their last turn.
Choose a card type, then reveal the grip. You may pay X[credit] to place X advancement tokens on an installed card. X is equal to or less than the number of revealed cards of the chosen type.
cards.title: Focus Group

cards.flavor: It is pitch black. You are likely to be eaten by a Troll.
cards.text: Play only if the Runner stole an agenda during their last turn. Choose a Runner card type. Trash all installed non-icebreaker cards of that type. The Runner may prevent any of those cards from being trashed by paying 3[credit] each. Take 1 bad publicity.
cards.title: Game Over

cards.flavor: As the documents show, for eight months they have operated as an entirely independent fiscal entity. We are as appalled at the carelessness as you are, and fully support City Hall's investigation.
cards.text: Whenever the Runner steals another agenda, you may forfeit this agenda to gain 5[credit] and add the stolen agenda to HQ.
cards.title: Divested Trust

cards.flavor: "Drones are precision instruments. Collateral damage is merely an undisclosed target." -Chief "Pinchy" Wilson
cards.text:
As an additional cost to steal this agenda, the Runner must trash an installed program.
When you score this agenda, trash an installed program.
cards.title: SDS Drone Deployment

cards.flavor: "There's something about the human touch that androids will never replace." -Mila Braun
cards.text: [click], [click], [click]: Gain 6[credit]. You may remove 1 bad publicity.
cards.title: Roughneck Repair Squad

cards.flavor: A choice occurs. The waveform collapses.
cards.text:
While this ice is protecting HQ, the Runner cannot break more than 1 of its printed subroutines during each encounter.
[subroutine]The Runner loses 2[credit].
[subroutine]End the run.
cards.title: Afshar

cards.text:
When you rez this ice, take 1 bad publicity.
[subroutine] Trash 1 installed Runner card.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 6</trace> If successful, the Runner cannot steal or trash Corp cards for the remainder of the run.
cards.title: Trebuchet

cards.text:
When you rez this upgrade, you may pay up to 4[credit] to place that many power counters on it.
As an additional cost to run this server, the Runner must pay 2[credit] for each hosted power counter.
Whenever the Runner makes a successful run on a central server, remove 1 hosted power counter.
cards.title: Reduced Service

cards.flavor: The Fracture was no different to any other crisis: Management's first instinct is to find someone to blame. Getting food up to Midway or He3 down to power Earthside hospitals are trivialities compared to the important work of salving Executive ego and keeping one's job.
cards.text: You cannot score this agenda if you installed it this turn.
cards.title: Vulnerability Audit

cards.flavor:
"By matching funds on your donations, the Space Elevator Authority has already planted over eight million trees on the Pacific coast. Together we can restore New Angeles to its former glory."
-Elizabeth Mills
cards.text: When your turn begins, you may draw 1 card.
cards.title: CSR Campaign
